NYU graduates received a total of 28 nominations for Hollywood’s second highest film honors, vieAlumni from the NYU Tisch School of the Arts (TSOA) made a strong showing when the Foreign Press Association announced its nominations for the 71st annual Golden Globe Awards on December 12. NYU graduates received a total of 28 nominations for Hollywood’s second highest film honors, viewed by industry insiders as an indicator of what could be in store at the Oscar ceremonies in March.     The 2014 Golden Globe Awards will air Sunday, January 12 on NBC from 8-11 p.m. ET, hosted by Tina Fey and Amy Poehler. Following is a list of all alumni from the TSOA community who are connected with the nominated films:    BEST MOTION PICTURE – DRAMA   12 Years A Slave (Plan B Entertainment, New Regency Productions and River Road Entertainment; Fox Searchlight Pictures)  • Steve McQueen ’94 (Kanbar, Film), director/producer   Captain Phillips (Columbia Pictures; Sony Pictures Releasing)  • Michael De Luca ’95 (BFA, Kanbar, F&TV), producer   BEST MOTION PICTURE – COMEDY OR MUSICAL   American Hustle (Columbia Pictures and Annapurna Pictures; Sony Pictures Releasing)  • Mark Kamine ’92 (MFA, Kanbar, Film), co-producer   Inside Llewyn Davis (Mike Zoss Productions, Scott Rudin Productions, Studio Canal; CBS Films)  • Joel Coen ’78 (BFA, Kanbar, F&TV), director/writer/producer  • Catherine Farrell ’99 (BFA, Kanbar, F&TV), associate producer  • Ron Halpern ’80 (BFA, Kanbar, F&TV), executive producer   The Wolf Of Wall Street (Paramount Pictures and Red Granite Pictures; Paramount Pictures)  • Georgia Kacandes ’85 (BFA, Kanbar, F&TV), executive producer   BEST DIRECTOR - MOTION PICTURE  • Steve McQueen ’94 (Kanbar, Film), 12 Years A Slave   BEST ORIGINAL SONG - MOTION PICTURE  "Please Mr. Kennedy" — Inside Llewyn Davis  • Joel Coen ’78 (BFA, Kanbar, F&TV), music/lyrics     BEST TELEVISION SERIES - DRAMA   Breaking Bad (AMC, Sony Pictures Television)  • Vince Gilligan ’89 (BFA, Kanbar, F&TV), director/writer/executive producer  • Thomas Schnauz ’88 (BFA, Kanbar, F&TV), writer/co-executive producer/producer/supervising producer  • Michael Slovis ’79 (Kanbar, Film), director   The Good Wife (CBS, CBS Television Studios in Association with Scott Free Productions and King Size Productions)  • Meredith Averill ’04 (BFA, Kanbar, Goldberg DDW), series writer/producer   House Of Cards (NETFLIX, Donen/Fincher/Roth and Trigger Street Productions, Inc. in association with Media Rights Capital for Netflix)  • Peter Mavromates ’84 (MFA, Kanbar, Film), co-producer   Masters Of Sex (Showtime, Sony Pictures Television, Round Two Productions, Timberman/Beverly Productions)  • Noelle Valdivia ’02 (BFA, Kanbar, Goldberg DDW), writer  • Christopher Goode ’87 (BFA, Kanbar, F&TV), co-producer   BEST PERFORMANCE BY AN ACTRESS IN A TELEVISION SERIES - DRAMA  • Taylor Schilling ’09 (Acting), Orange Is The New Black   BEST TELEVISION SERIES - COMEDY OR MUSICAL   Brooklyn Nine-Nine (Fox, Universal Television)  • Andy Samberg ’00 (BFA, Kanbar, F&TV), producer   Modern Family (ABC, Twentieth Century Fox Television)  • Paul Corrigan ’94 (BFA, Kanbar F&TV), writer/producer  • Brad Walsh ’94 (BFA, Kanbar F&TV), writer/producer  • Bill Wrubel ’94 (MFA, Kanbar, Goldberg DDW), writer/producer   Parks and Recreation (NBC, Universal Television)  • Nicole Holofcener ’84 (BFA, Kanbar, F&TV), director   BEST PERFORMANCE BY AN ACTOR IN A TELEVISION SERIES - COMEDY OR MUSICAL  • Andy Samberg ’00 (BFA, Kanbar, F&TV), Brooklyn Nine-Nine   BEST MINI-SERIES OR MOTION PICTURE MADE FOR TELEVISION   American Horror Story: Coven (FX Networks, Ryan Murphy Television and Brad Falchuk Teley-Vision in association With Twentieth Century Fox Television)  • Alfonso Gomez-Rejon ’94 (BFA, Kanbar, F&TV), director/co-executive producer  • Jessica Sharzer ’02 (MFA, Kanbar, Film), writer/co-executive producer/supervising producer   Behind The Candelabra (HBO, HBO Films in association With Jerry Weintraub Productions)  • Richard LaGravenese ’80 (BFA, Acting), writer   BEST PERFORMANCE BY AN ACTOR IN A SUPPORTING ROLE IN A SERIES, MINI-SERIES OR MOTION PICTURE MADE FOR TELEVISION  • Corey Stoll ’03 (MFA, Acting), House Of Cards   ###                            This Press Release is in the following Topics:      Tisch School of the Arts           Type: Press Release            Press Contact:                Shonna Keogan | (212) 998-6796                                            Tisch alumnus Steve McQueen's "12 Years a Slave" garnered two Golden Globe nominations - for best picture and best director. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service         School of Continuing and Professional Studies         School of Law         School of Medicine         Silver School of Social Work         Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development         Tisch School of the Arts                            Select a Topic             All University         Athletics         Awards         Division of Libraries         Events and Traditions         Institute of Fine Arts         International Houses         Research         nyu alumni magazine                       View articles from:          Through:             Advanced Search                                         NYU In the News   NYU Received a Record Number of Applications   Capital New York reported NYU received a record 60,322 applications for the class of 2019, an increase of about 15 percent since last year.     NYU Students Help City Crack Down on Hookah Bars   Capital New York reported that NYU students helped New York City crack down on hookah bars that illegally include tobacco in their hookahs:     Rudin Center Study Says Mass Transit Helps Economic Mobility   The Wall Street Journal wrote about a report by Wagner’s Rudin Center that showed that mass transit could be more important than education in determining economic mobility.     Brennan Center Report Says Campaign Spending Has Jumped   Frontline did a piece about a report by the Brennan Center for Justice that said that campaign spending by outside groups has more than doubled in the last five years.     NYU’s Dorms Ranked Among the Best in the Nation   Hometalk.com ranked NYU’s student residences third in the country in its list of best college dorms.
